TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, JcoolTheShipbuilder said:

> also who was the first ever forum user and first ever post?
> 

Would you believe me if I said we don't know?

The account with the lowest usernumber is aLeXmOrA, with the usernumber of 3. For reference, my usernumber is 123,837 and yours is 204,576.

The thread with the lowest number is [https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/2-ksp-forums-is-now-online/](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ) but the topic number is 2, implying that there was at least one thread before that.

The forum had a burp and lost about 1/3 of the registered user accounts. It's often referred to as either the *Great Forum Crash* or the *Great Forum Purge*. It's the first time I have heard it referred to a the Forum Derp.  

I had been a member since August 2012 and my original account was lost. So...

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, adsii1970 said:
> 
> 
> I had been a member since August 2012 and my original account was lost. So...
> 

Goes to show how many people re-registered or registered in the few months after the crash/purge/derp.  I originally signed up in Nov '12, but almost immediately re-registered in May after the derp.  64k vs 187k
If someone is “following” you what does that involve? Do they get notifications every time you post something or is it more like a bookmark of sorts so they can access your activity/profile quickly?

Why do the [@Jebediah Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/109744-jebediah-kerman/) [@Bill Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/127154-bill-kerman/) [@Bob Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/127156-bob-kerman/) [@Gene Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129081-gene-kerman/) [@Wernher von Kerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129085-wernher-von-kerman/) test accounts have such high rep? Also why do they have high user numbers despite being created before [@aLeXmOrA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/3-alexmora/)'s account (which appears to be the first legit account)

The answer to this question is probably lost to the sands of time, because I don't think anybody now on the Squad team was there when these were made.

Also why do they have high user numbers despite being created before [@aLeXmOrA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/3-alexmora/)'s account (which appears to be the first legit account)
> 

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> The answer to this question is probably lost to the sands of time, because I don't think anybody now on the Squad team was there when these were made.
> 

I asked Sal this very question when he first asked me to work on images for the forum. The original plan was to have those who were promoters of the game (we now call them community managers) to use those accounts for official "KSP developer" announcements. But over time, it was too much hassle to maintain who was supposed to use what account. Those accounts still exist. Over time, it became easier to have the various staff members use their own accounts. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

At least that's what I was told a few years back...
